Company: Sid Richardson Carbon and Energy Company
Description: The EPA and the Department of Justice announced a Clean Air Act settlement with Sid Richardson Carbon designed to significantly reduce air pollution from three carbon black manufacturing plants in Louisiana and Texas. The settlement included a civil penalty of $999,000, spending of $490,000 on  environmental mitigation projects, and the installation of pollution control equipment that the EPA estimated would cost more than $100 million.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
